duties_responsibilities.duty: Develops programs and services to establish the organization as a leader in older adult care.
Implements a strategic business plan in collaboration with other members of the senior services team.
Works with clinical leaders and entities to better serve older adults by incorporating principles of geriatric care.
Encourages and supports research activity in geriatric care and develops methods to share new knowledge.
Initiates and directs marketing, public relations, and publicity relative to the Senior Service Line in collaboration with Marketing and Business Development.
Performs ongoing analysis of the marketplace in collaboration with market research.
Analyzes and works directly with physician groups relative to older adult services to promote strength areas, address weaknesses, and develop programs.
Develops and recommends operating and capital budgets and controls expenditures within approved budget objectives.
Performs human resources responsibilities for staff, including interviewing, selection, staff development, and performance evaluations.
Maintains expertise in clinical knowledge and keeps current in clinical issues related to geriatrics/gerontology.

education_certification.credential: Master's Degree in Health Care Administration or related field
